dict.acceptation: 异常的，引人注目的，；卓越的；显著的；非凡的，非常（好）的；

sent.orig: And the reason they can do such remarkable things is because they are remarkable.
sent.trans: 他们能做不同凡响的事情的原因就是因为他们本身就是不同凡响的。

sent.orig: That is indeed remarkable! That is indeed a remarkable thing!
sent.trans: 那可真了不起！那真是了不起的事情！

sent.orig: The walk down Broadway, then as now, was one of the remarkable features of the city.
sent.trans: 漫步百老汇大街，在当时也和现在一样，是这个城市引人注目的特色之一。

sent.orig: Deerslayer yielded himself a prisoner with a dignity that was a remarkable as his self-devotion.
sent.trans: 打鹿将只好就擒，但他那庄严的气势和对方的豪侠一样惊人。

sent.orig: It was truly remarkable piece of amalgamation.
sent.trans: 这是一次异乎寻常的合并。
